definition: lit. a nobleman stays clear of the kitchen (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. a nobleman who has seen a living animal cannot bear to see it die, hence he keeps away from the kitchen

sentences.english: Whellole she read the paper, I cleaned up the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 她看报期间怎样才能醒酒，我打扫庖厨。

sentences.english: the cupboards in her kitchen were full of things she did not need.
sentences.chinese: 她庖厨的纱橱中放满了她不需要的东西。

sentences.english: I followed my mother into the kitchen.
We have a few kitchen thellongs and a dining room set.
sentences.chinese: 我们有一些庖厨用具和一套餐厅设备。

sentences.english: My mother is doing cooking in the kitchen.
I have to wear white and I have to keep everything in the kitchen totally clean.
sentences.chinese: 我必须穿白的，必须让庖厨的一切保持整洁。
史密斯夫人的庖厨很小。

sentences.english: He loves cooking. Preparing meals and dishes is a joy for him.
sentences.chinese: 他爱好烹饪，做饭做菜对他来说都是庖厨乐事。

definition: lit. a nobleman stays clear of the kitchen (idiom, from Mencius)/fig. a nobleman who has seen a living animal cannot bear to see it die, hence he keeps away from the kitchen
lit. to eat but finely ground grain and finely chopped meat (idiom, from Analects)/fig. to be fastidious about one's food
pinyin: shi2 bu4 yan4 jing1 , kuai4 bu4 yan4 xi4

definition: rarities from the mountain and the sea (idiom); fig. a sumptuous spread of food delicacies
people from ancient times/the ancients/the late (i.e. person who has passed away)
variant of 宴饗|宴飨[yan4 xiang3]
to host a banquet/feast/banquet/ceremony of sacrifice
to light a fire and cook a meal
